TI: [Effect of propyl-2-pentene-2-oic acid on GABA levels in different regions of mouse brain].
AB: An elevation in cerebral GABA level (65%) is observed after administration of an anticonvulsant, sodium propyl 2-pentene-2 oate, a branched chain fatty acid, comformationally restricted GABA analogue, competitive inhibitor of GABA-T in regard to GABA. The concentration of GABA increases in some regions i.e. substantia nigra, frontal and temporal cortex, cerebellum and olfactory bulbs. The GABA level remains unchanged in caudate nucleus, hippocampus and occipital cortex. Results are discussed comparatively to the effect of sodium n-dipropylacetate.
TT: Variations de la teneur en GABA de certaines zones du cerveau de la souris sous l'effet de l'acide propyl-2-pentene-2 oique.
TA: C R Seances Soc Biol Fil
JT: Comptes rendus des seances de la Societe de biologie et de ses filiales
SO: C R Seances Soc Biol Fil. 1978;172(4):707-12.
